description: Borrowed from translingual Ctenophora; equivalent to cteno- +â€Ž -phore.

entries.meaning: Any of various marine animals of the phylum Ctenophora, having lucent, mucilaginous bodies bearing eight rows of comblike cilia used for swimming. [from 19th c.]
examples: Ctenophores are abundant in the oceans, but long-neglected by scientists.
